natural solution: First, we use the distributive property to expand the first two factors: \begin{align} 4(x-5)(x+8) &= (4\cdot x - 4 \cdot 5) (x+8)\\ &=(4x-20)(x+8) \end{align}We use the distributive property again by adding the product of $4x-20$ and $x$ to the product of $4x-20$ and 8: \begin{align}
We use the distributive property again and combine like terms: \begin{align} x(4x-20) + 8(4x-20) &= 4x^2 - 20x + 32x - 160\\ &= \boxed{4x^2 + 12x - 160} \end{align}

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 4 * (x - 5) * (x + 8)"
shows  "P x = 4 * x powr 2 + 12 * x - 160"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand the product ${4(x-5)(x+8)}$. The final Answer is 4x^2 + 12x - 160
 ### Proof
 First, we use the distributive property to expand the first two factors: \begin{align} 4(x-5)(x+8) &= (4\cdot x - 4 \cdot 5) (x+8)\\ &=(4x-20)(x+8) \end{align}We use the distributive property again by adding the product of $4x-20$ and $x$ to the product of $4x-20$ and 8: \begin{align}
 (4x-20)(x+8) &= (4x-20) \cdot x +(4x-20) \cdot 8\\ &= x(4x-20) + 8(4x-20) \end{align}
 We use the distributive property again and combine like terms: \begin{align} x(4x-20) + 8(4x-20) &= 4x^2 - 20x + 32x - 160\\ &= \boxed{4x^2 + 12x - 160} \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 4 * (x - 5) * (x + 8)"
shows  "P x = 4 * x powr 2 + 12 * x - 160"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Express the function $P(x)$ as $4(x-5)(x+8)$. Rewrite this expression in the form $P(x)=4x^2+12x-160$.
